definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.

sentences.english: By the end of his shows, only a few iron beasts still move.
sentences.chinese: 每次表演结束，还能自己动弹的铁武士就寥寥可数了。

sentences.english: But "fewer than a dozen people" are looking in this direction, she said.
sentences.chinese: 但是朝这个方向研究的人寥寥无几，她说。

sentences.english: Specifically, in the blogosphere, the vast majority of blogs have very few readers.
sentences.chinese: 特别是在博客圈，大多数的博客都只有寥寥几名读者。

sentences.english: Very few people were present at the meeting.
That brief sketch is about all I ever really knew about my father.
sentences.chinese: 上面寥寥几笔便是我迄今为止对父亲的全部了解。

sentences.english: Besides, there are very few skilled stone workers left after the war years.
sentences.chinese: 此外，在战后年代之后，有技术的石工寥寥无几。

sentences.english: Currently, there are few interventions whose effectiveness has been scientifically proven.
sentences.chinese: 目前，在有效性上得到科学论证的干预措施寥寥无几。

sentences.english: A smile note or quick phone call could be just what they need .
sentences.chinese: 简短的留言或寥寥数语的电话可能正是他们所需要的。

sentences.english: Although a few words, but The role of such incentives are inestimable.
sentences.chinese: 虽然寥寥数语，但这样激励所起的作用是不可估量的。

sentences.english: The Chaco was for sale a few years ago. No one wanted it.
sentences.chinese: 几年前查科也出售过土地，但应者寥寥。

sentences.english: So many people have flu that hardly any policemen reported for duty.
sentences.chinese: 患流行性感冒的人太多，连去执勤的警察也寥寥无几。

sentences.english: I took my seat in a third-class carriage of a deserted train.
sentences.chinese: 我在一节三等车厢上坐下来，列车上乘客寥寥。

sentences.english: If I had asked how many people beat their wives I would not have got a much more muted response.
sentences.chinese: 我看我要是问谁打老婆，估计也不会像这样应者寥寥。

sentences.english: The meagre Latin class recited with honor.
sentences.chinese: 寥寥数人的拉丁语班背诵时显得无比自豪。

sentences.english: Although several said they had high school degrees, Honda requires only junior high school educations.
sentences.chinese: 仅寥寥数人进过高中，本田招聘条件，初中以上即可。

sentences.english: A very few seagulls were working the updrafts on the cliffs.
sentences.chinese: 海边峭壁上，寥寥几只海鸥正在向上奋飞。

definition: just a very few (idiom); tiny number/just a handful/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
just a very few (idiom); tiny number/not many at all/You count them on your fingers.
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
lit. as rare as phoenix feathers and unicorn horns (idiom)/fig. few and far between
generally speaking/by and large/for the most part
up to the maximum/upper limit/at most
rare as morning stars (idiom)/few and far between/sparse
just a word or two (idiom); a few isolated phrases
